Hello Again.
There are other names, RESTFULIE works for Ruby and Java, also=
 RESTEasy from JBOSS, and of course Axis 2 has a REST mode.
Using one of th=
e other depends on what do you need, and what are you using. None is perfec=
t, by the way, but there is a lot of effort put on each one. You need to tr=
y them first, my advice.

William Martinez Pomares.

hoogroups.com, "photogspassion" <artyyeo@...> wrote:
>
> So, I have read Ri=
chardson and Ruby's "RESTful Web Services". The book is great for the found=
ational rationale of REST. But, when it comes to implementations, there wer=
e RESTlet when it comes to the Java world.
>

re these:
> 1) RESTlet

g at?

?
